resources.string: If accessibility Face Unlock is turned off, some setup steps may not work properly with TalkBack.
On the next screen, rotate your head to capture all angles of your face
On the next screen, hold your phone at eye level
How to set up Face Unlock
Face enrolment time limit reached. Try again.
Now you can use your face to unlock your phone or verify that it’s you, like when you sign in to apps or approve a purchase

"Now when you pick up your phone or tap the screen, you can use your face to unlock.
Face Unlock works best when there’s enough light and you’re not wearing a mask or dark glasses."

"Delete your current face model to set up Face Unlock again.
Your face model will be permanently and securely deleted.
After deletion, you will need your PIN, pattern or password to unlock your phone or for authentication in apps."

"Delete your current face model to set up Face Unlock again.
Your face model will be permanently and securely deleted.
After deletion, you will need your fingerprint, PIN, pattern or password to unlock your phone or for authentication in apps."
Setup for limited vision or head motion
When using Face Unlock, your head may need to be more directly in front of your phone.
Using your child’s face to unlock their phone may be less secure than a strong pattern or PIN.
Allow your child to use their face to unlock their phone

"You and your child can delete their face model or turn off Face Unlock at any time in Settings. Face models are stored on the phone until they’re deleted.
Learn more at g.co/pixel/faceunlock."
You and your child are in control

"You can delete your face model or turn off Face Unlock at any time in Settings. Face models are stored on the phone until you delete them.
Learn more at g.co/pixel/faceunlock."

"Face Unlock creates a unique model of your child’s face to verify that it’s them. To create this face model during setup, your child will take images of their face from different angles.
When they use Face Unlock, images are used to update their face model. Images used to create their face model are not stored, but the face model is stored securely on the phone and never leaves the phone. All processing occurs securely on the phone."

"Face Unlock creates a unique model of your face to verify that it’s you. To create this face model during setup, you will take images of your face from different angles.
When you use Face Unlock, images are used to update your face model. Images used to create your face model are not stored, but the face model is stored securely on your phone and never leaves the phone. All processing occurs securely on your phone."
Face Unlock can require your child’s eyes to be open to unlock the phone or verify that it’s them. You and your child can turn this option on at any time in Settings.
If your child normally wears glasses, they can wear them during setup.
Using your child’s face to unlock their phone may be less secure than a strong pattern, PIN or password

Looking at the phone can unlock it even when they don’t intend to. Their phone can also be unlocked by someone who looks a lot like them, like an identical sibling, or if someone holds it up to their face.
Face Unlock can require your eyes to be open to unlock the phone or verify that it’s you. You can turn this option on at any time in Settings.
Glasses or lightly tinted sunglasses are OK.
Using your face to unlock your phone may be less secure than a strong pattern, PIN or password

Looking at the phone can unlock it even when you don’t intend to. Your phone can also be unlocked by someone who looks a lot like you, like an identical sibling, or if someone holds it up to your face.
Use your face to unlock your phone or verify that it’s you, like when you sign in to apps or approve a purchase.
Use your face to unlock your phone, authorize purchases or sign in to apps

"Use your face to unlock your phone or approve purchases.
Note: You can’t use your face to unlock this device. For more information, contact your organization’s admin."
To improve performance, you can set up Face Unlock again in Settings
Centre your face in the circle

"Try fast setup instead. Keep in mind that your head may need to be more directly in front of your phone when using Face Unlock.
To improve performance, you can set up Face Unlock again in Settings."
Face Unlock setup can’t be completed because the phone is too hot. Try again later when the phone cools down.
Use Face Unlock to unlock your phone

"Use your face to unlock your phone or for authentication in apps, like when you sign in or approve a purchase.
Keep in mind: You can only have one face set up at a time. To add another face, delete the current one.
Looking at the phone can unlock it when you don’t intend to.
Your phone can be unlocked by someone else if it’s held up to your face.
Your phone can be unlocked by someone who looks a lot like you, like an identical sibling."

"Use your face to unlock your phone or for authentication in apps, like when you sign in or approve a purchase.
Keep in mind: You can only have one face set up at a time. To add another face, delete the current one.
Looking at the phone can unlock it when you don’t intend to.
Your phone can be unlocked by someone else if it’s held up to your face, even if your eyes are closed.
Your phone can be unlocked by someone who looks a lot like you, like an identical sibling."

"Your face model will be permanently and securely deleted.
After deletion, you will need your PIN, pattern or password to unlock your phone or for authentication in apps."

"Your face model will be permanently and securely deleted.
After deletion, you will need your PIN, pattern or password to unlock your phone."
To unlock the phone, your eyes must be open
When using Face Unlock in apps, always require confirmation step
